detailsOfAchievement: Ramakrishna Vivekananda ashram Kalaburgi is proactively trying its level best to chisel the personality of this youth of Hyderabad Karnataka area which has been categorized with 371J by the Government. With the passage of time the nation with an imperishable heritage, is searching for its identity. Ramakrishna Kendra is catering and instilling the identity of national character of youth With a period of more than a decade the the Ashrama is functioning with a noble cause to provide value based education to more than 1000 boys and girls of rural Karnataka, that too the children from nomadic and semi-nomadic parents, the students are from marginalized BPL family. They are identified and chosen by choice by personal visit and rapport of Pujya Swami Maheshwaranandaji with parents in Kalaburagi, Bidar, Yadgiri, Raichur, Bellari, Koppal, Gadag and Belagavi districts. The results are performance to the last 15 years is above 95 %. The school is residential in its nature and looks after the uniform, books and food for inmates. The school activities include prayer, sports, and messages of Swami Vivekananda. School and ashramas credential is the visit and interaction with 1200 students on 25th Dec 2010 by then President of India Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam. Sir was kind enough to appreciate the talent of students and motivated the efforts of the school.

Their children also accompany them such children are deprived off education therefore, society provides residential facility, so that, they attend to school. 3) The society provides free education to poor student upto 10th standard. 4) While educating them awareness is created among them regarding nationality, indian culture, particularly banjara culture. 5) Thus the society is helping poor student in their all round development.

detailsOfAchievement: SOCHARA has worked on various health and development issues, towards the goal of Health for All. - SOCHARA has primarily been a professional resource group in community health and public health  for other NGOs and the government. The organisations role has been critical in Karnatakas health policy, the Commission on Social Determinants of Health (WHO), and the National Rural Health Mission or NRHM (India), and the National Mental Health Policy. - SOCHARA has been a hub for networking, because the ethos is that more can be done by getting together and working together. Networks such as All India Drug Action Network, and Medico Friend Circle have been created or nurtured at SOCHARA. Several local networks in Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh have been supported. - SOCHARA has been a place where several young health leaders have interned over the past 3 decades, and have been mentored continuously. A formal one-year community health fellowship programme for young interested persons was conducted since 2003, through with over 300 fellows have graduated (either as full time or flexi fellows). - More recently, SOCHARA has been engaged directly in community level action. In Tamil Nadu, being the state nodal NGO for Community Action for Health (part of NRHM), our team was directly working in over 446 panchayats in Tamil Nadu towards establishing and training Village Health and Sanitation Committees to create village health plans, and engage in monitoring processes. Some colleagues also work on low-cost toilet model construction in rural areas of Karnataka over the past 8 years. Our colleagues in Madhya Pradesh are working with Anganwadis covering 4000 children, towards improving nutrition. - Support has been given to several local organisations in rural Karnataka to take up sanitation as an important issue, and to provide technical information on construction of low cost toilets and to leverage governmental funds - Evaluations have been conducted by us for large organisations and programmes such as the Mitanin Programme (health workers) in Chhattisgarh, Catholic Health Association of India (golden jubilee), St Johns National Academy of Health Sciences (golden jubilee). - Support has been given to research activities to bring forward the plight of marginalised groups  such as women suffering burns due to domestic violence, rural communities impacted by heat waves, and women having poor access to toilets in rural areas - SOCHARA has continuously supported communities affected by natural and manmade disasters, to rebuild their lives by using a community health approach. This work has included the latest Chennai flood in 2015, and the earlier Tsunami, Gujarat earth quake, Orissa cyclone and Bhopal disaster - Since late 2016, we have started engaging with rural people in facilitating experiences of local problem solving in food, water, sanitation and healthcare systems. The vision is to wipe out seasonal hunger from 50,000 villages in India over the next 5 years, among other things.

title: SOUKYA FOUNDATION CHARITABLE TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: SOUKYA FOUNDATION CHARITABLE TRUST SOUKYA Foundation was started with a vision of making Complete Health Care accessible to the common man through Ayurveda, Naturopathy, Homeopathy and Yoga, the focus being Preventive, early intervention and cure. SOUKYA Foundation runs several charitable and free clinics in different parts of Bengaluru benefitting patients from all sectors of society. Conducting Research & Development Education etc are among the various activities undertaken by the SOUKYA Foundation. The trust is also recognised by Scientific and Industrial Research Organisations (SIROs). Dr Issac Mathai is the Managing Trustee and Mrs Suja Issac is the Trustee. Dr Mathais Rural Holistic Health Care takes care of Community Health and is an integrated model of AYUSH Systems with Allopathy as the Centre is in a Government Primary health Centre taking care of about 40,000 population in 38 villages since 2013. Focused work in this area covers the population of 5791 people belonging to Jadigenahalli Grama Panchayath Since 2008 - Holistic Homeopathy Clinic (HHC)  Shishu Mandir School for Orphans were patients are coming from about 45,000 in 15 villages in and around Bhattarahalli HHC - Christel House School for the Poor since 2007, KSRTC DEPOT since 2009, KARNATAKA STATE RESERVE POLICE since 2010 provides Free Health Care. As part of Centre of Excellence in Homeopathy for Respiratory Diseases workshops were conducted and Training  National & International Doctors were provided. Centre of Excellence has a Respiratory Laboratory. State of art with the latest investigation by Diffuse lung Carbon Monoxide identification of Total Lung capacity with DLCO and about 4 Spriometries are available for checking various Respiratory conditions. Online course on Orientation to Research Methodology was conducted in collaboration with Chest Research Foundation and with the technical support CCRH, Delhi. Research Publications: 1) The Homoeopathic Heritage  ISSN : 9070-6038 Vol 40, No. 2, May 2014 on Respiratory Tract Infection in a case of COPD: A Case Report 2) Homeopathy for All  ISSN: 0973-9823, Vol.16 No. 5(173) May 2014 on An Observational Study on URTI 40 Children with Homeopathic Medicines and Dietary Support Dr Mathais Rural Holistic Health Centre (DMRC) is an initiative of SOUKYA Foundation Charitable Trust work in the Rural Area The work of DMRC of SOUKYA Foundation is presently carried on in Government Primary Health Centre, Jadigenahalli Gram panchayath Hoskote Taluk Bengaluru Rural. Dr.Issac Mathai & Mrs. Suja Issac constructed and donated a building for rural work in Memory of Late Rev.Fr.Mathai Nooranal (Dr.Mathais father) which was inaugurated by Honourable Chief Minister Shri.Siddarammiah on 15.11.2014, in the premises of Primary Health Centre of Jadigenahalli Grama Panchayath during The Third International Conference  Global Health Futures. Papers published on this programme  Published in the Institute of Social and Economic Change (ISEC) working papers and available in www.isec.ac.in  Journal of Holistic Health care-Research Traditional medicine-Holistic Approach to improve Community Health AYUSH approach. Volume 12 Issue 2 Summer 2015-ISSN 1743-9493  Journal of Development Management and Communication-Holistic Health for Wellness-Experiences from peri-urban locale of Bengaluru City. Volume II Number 4 October-December, 2015 ISSN 2348-7739
